description: Prep the night before and once you wake up and bake, be rewarded by thickly sliced brioche bread soaked in luscious custard and topped with a crunchy, spice-kissed streusel topping.
headline: Overnight French Toast with Cinnamon Streusel

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: The bread can be toasted up to 1 day in advance, cooled, and stored in an airtight container at room temperature.Storage: The casserole is best when served immediately after baking. Refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for up to 4 days.

name: Overnight French Toast with Cinnamon Streusel
recipeIngredient: 1 (1-pound) unsliced loaf brioche or challah bread
Cooking spray or butter, for the baking dish
1/3 cup maple syrup, plus more for serving
1/4 cup packed light or dark brown sugar
1/4 teaspoon freshly grated or ground nutmeg

recipeInstructions.text: Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 300°F.

Cut 1 loaf brioche or challah bread into 3/4-inch thick slices (about 12). Fit a wire rack inside a rimmed baking sheet. Place the bread in a single layer on the rack. Bake until dry to the touch on both sides, about 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, make the topping and custard.

Place 4 tablespoons unsalted butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high power in 10-second bursts, stirring between each, until melted, about 40 seconds total. (Alternatively, melt on the stove.)

Add 2/3 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 packed cup brown sugar, 2 tablespoons granulated sugar, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon freshly grated or ground nutmeg, and 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt. Using your fingertips, mix the dry ingredients into the butter until the flour is completely moistened and small, pea-sized clusters form.
Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with butter or cooking spray.
Place 8 large eggs, 2 cups half-and-half, 1/3 cup maple syrup, 1 tablespoon vanilla extract, and 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt in a large bowl and whisk until combined.
Working with a couple bread slices at a time, soak, flipping once, until moistened but not falling apart, 1 to 2 minutes per batch.
Arrange the slices in the baking dish in two rows, overlapping the slices slightly. Pour any remaining custard over the top. Sprinkle the streusel evenly over the bread.
Cover the baking dish tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight, preferably 8 to 12 hours.
Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 350°F. Uncover and let the casserole sit at room temperature while the oven heats.

Bake until the bread is puffed, golden brown, and a tester inserted in the center comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes. Check after 35 minutes: If the top is getting too dark, loosely tent with aluminum foil and continue baking.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Dust with powdered sugar if desired and serve with more maple syrup.
